channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Wall Street sinks under the weight of its own expectations as Big Tech’s AI high fades and Fed doubts creep in
item.description: AI darlings Palantir, Nvidia, and Tesla slide, sinking the S&P and the Dow in the early going Tuesday.

item.title: Small Businesses Gear Up for Tariff Fight at Supreme Court
item.description: Companies that sell diamonds, plant sensors and wine all have one thing in common: They are weighing in against tariffs in a consequential case.

item.title: New York’s mayoral race becomes a national test of economic populism as Mamdani challenges Cuomo’s comeback
item.description: New York City's voters are deciding the outcome of a generational and ideological divide that will resonate across the country.

item.title: Republicans Hold Firm on Filibuster and Prosecutor Veto Power, Despite Trump’s Frustrations
item.description: President Trump is showing mounting frustration at his inability to win confirmation of U.S. attorneys in blue states or break the filibuster's grip o...

item.title: Dick Cheney: A Life in Pictures
item.description: The former vice president helped shaped the role of the United States around the world.

item.title: IBM’s CEO disagrees with JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon’s disdain for texting in meetings: ‘Telling people they can’t use their technology would be weird’
item.description: Jamie Dimon calls checking your email during a meeting disrespectful—but IBM’s CEO says he doesn’t care, depending on the number of people in the room...

item.title: What Block’s CFO and finance team want peers to know about Bitcoin
item.description: Block, Inc. made its first corporate bitcoin purchase in 2020.

item.title: Bold Assassinations Are Grim ‘Reality Check’ in Mexico’s Cartel Fight
item.description: The murder of Mexico’s most vocal anti-crime mayor shows that, despite President Claudia Sheinbaum’s crackdown on drug cartels, the battle is just beg...

item.title: MS … NOW? As MSNBC Rebrands, a $20 Million Effort to Avoid Confusion.
item.description: After three decades, the MSNBC brand will be retired on Nov. 15. The network has called in Rachel Maddow to help viewers make the transition.

item.title: Dictionary.com risks Gen Z mockery by crowning ‘6-7’ as word of the year
item.description: “Don’t worry, because we’re all still trying to figure out exactly what it means," the site said in its unusual announcement that lacked a definition.

item.title: U.N. Report on Greenhouse Gas Emissions Finds Slight Progress
item.description: The annual U.N. report card finds that, overall, countries are still far off-track from their stated goals to limit global warming.

item.title: Kim Yong-nam, Longtime Ceremonial Head of North Korea, Dead at 97
item.description: In a country where political purges are frequent, Mr. Kim was a notable exception and served three generations of its dynastic rulers.

item.title: Bold Assassinations Are Grim ‘Reality Check’ in Mexico’s Cartel Fight
item.description: The murder of Mexico’s most vocal anti-crime mayor shows that, despite President Claudia Sheinbaum’s crackdown on drug cartels, the battle is just beg...

item.title: China’s Global Exports Continue to Grow Despite Trump Tariffs
item.description: As Trump has imposed steep tariffs on China, American importers are buying much less. But China has offset the decline from the United States with bre...

item.title: At Least 26 Dead as Typhoon Brings Flooding to Central Philippines
item.description: Most of the victims drowned, the authorities said. Hundreds of thousands of people evacuated before Typhoon Kalmaegi hit on Tuesday.
